docs.abstract: A proposal to make New York the third state to ban menthol cigarettes has created a furious and expensive lobbying war, and has divided Black leaders.
docs.snippet: A proposal to make New York the third state to ban menthol cigarettes has created a furious and expensive lobbying war, and has divided Black leaders.
docs.lead_paragraph: ALBANY, N.Y. — A push by Gov. Kathy Hochul to ban menthol-flavored cigarettes in New York has become the focal point of a fierce and expensive lobbying fight, pitting Big Tobacco against the medical community.

headline.main: Black Smokers at Center of New York Fight to Ban Menthol Cigarettes

docs.abstract: An Australian, he assisted South African dissidents like the journalist Donald Woods, whose story was told in the movie “Cry Freedom.”
docs.snippet: An Australian, he assisted South African dissidents like the journalist Donald Woods, whose story was told in the movie “Cry Freedom.”
docs.lead_paragraph: Bruce Haigh, an Australian diplomat who brushed aside the protocols of his profession to offer covert support to anti-apartheid figures in South Africa, including the banned newspaper editor depicted in the movie “Cry Freedom,” died on April 7 in Australia. He was 77.

headline.main: Bruce Haigh, Diplomat Who Helped Battle Apartheid, Dies at 77

docs.abstract: Yannick Nézet-Séguin, the company’s music director, is conducting a beloved production of Puccini’s perennial classic for the first time.
docs.snippet: Yannick Nézet-Séguin, the company’s music director, is conducting a beloved production of Puccini’s perennial classic for the first time.
docs.lead_paragraph: Winter grips Paris at the start of the third act of Puccini’s “La Bohème.”

headline.main: Review: In ‘La Bohème’ at the Met, the Star Is in the Pit

docs.abstract: Readers discuss a doctor’s essay about patients being “ready” to die. Also: A liberal arts education; 90 years old, or is it 60?
docs.snippet: Readers discuss a doctor’s essay about patients being “ready” to die. Also: A liberal arts education; 90 years old, or is it 60?

docs.abstract: Ginger-scallion steamed fish, pasta primavera and a very green salad are light yet filling.
docs.snippet: Ginger-scallion steamed fish, pasta primavera and a very green salad are light yet filling.
docs.lead_paragraph: Good morning. Not to put too fine a point on something I’ve been saying for years, but the purpose of this newsletter is to seek out and champion the delicious. I’m here to provide comfort at times, to offer counsel, to instruct and to cajole. But I’m always here as an ambassador of succulence, an envoy of the flavorful. I want you to cook, yes, but also to experience the joy of serving — and eating — really good food.

docs.abstract: Republicans gathered in the state Saturday in a kickoff event that lacked the attendance of two front-runners, though their presence was felt.
docs.snippet: Republicans gathered in the state Saturday in a kickoff event that lacked the attendance of two front-runners, though their presence was felt.
docs.lead_paragraph: More than nine months before the Iowa caucuses, eight declared and potential presidential candidates came to a gathering of Christian conservatives on Saturday evening to test a question: Can flesh-and-blood politicians eyeing the highest office in the land be upstaged by a canned, prerecorded video?

headline.main: An Iowa Campaign Event Defined More by Those Who Were Not There Than Those Who Were

docs.abstract: Gervonta Davis stopped Ryan Garcia in seven rounds in a highly anticipated fight in Las Vegas. Next up for Davis: a sentencing and an arraignment in separate criminal cases against him.
docs.snippet: Gervonta Davis stopped Ryan Garcia in seven rounds in a highly anticipated fight in Las Vegas. Next up for Davis: a sentencing and an arraignment in separate criminal cases against him.
docs.lead_paragraph: LAS VEGAS — An hour after he landed the left uppercut to the rib cage that dropped Ryan Garcia for a 10-count in the seventh round, Gervonta Davis returned to the ring at T-Mobile Arena to put his hands on Garcia again.

headline.main: Davis Floors Garcia, but Heads Into an Uncertain Future

docs.abstract: It will take not only policy change but also social change to turn the tide.
docs.snippet: It will take not only policy change but also social change to turn the tide.
docs.lead_paragraph: Tomorrow will mark four weeks from the day that three 9-year-olds and three adults were murdered at a Christian school in Nashville. The family and friends of those who were killed will never be the same. They are only at the very beginning of a long, hard journey through deepest grief. But in many ways, our nation has moved on.

headline.main: What Should Christians Do About Guns?

docs.abstract: Israelis are bracing for a tense Memorial Day and the 75th anniversary of their country’s founding as a political crisis tears it apart.
docs.snippet: Israelis are bracing for a tense Memorial Day and the 75th anniversary of their country’s founding as a political crisis tears it apart.
docs.lead_paragraph: Every Memorial Day, thousands of families who have lost brothers, sisters and siblings to Israel’s endless wars and terrorist attacks gather to remember the dead, a commemoration that was to have been followed this year by a jubilant celebration of the 75th anniversary of the founding of the country.

headline.main: Political Chaos Unsettles Israel as It Looks to Honor the Fallen and Its Independence

docs.abstract: As a rabbi, I can’t prevent anti-Semitic acts in America, but I can work to alleviate the fear that threats create.
docs.snippet: As a rabbi, I can’t prevent anti-Semitic acts in America, but I can work to alleviate the fear that threats create.
docs.lead_paragraph: One chilly January morning this year, a masked man dressed in dark clothing walked up the driveway of the synagogue where I am a rabbi in Bloomfield, N.J., and threw a Molotov cocktail at the building. Luckily, our doors held, the flames went out upon impact and no one was hurt. Still, the incident left our 540-family congregation shaken. We canceled religious school mere minutes before students were set to arrive, inevitably forcing parents to answer questions they were not prepared for.

headline.main: My Synagogue Was Attacked, but That’s Not What Scares Me Most
